required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects on Health Related Quality of Life Among Patients With Chronic Pain by Interventional Pain Management
clinical_study.official_title: Effects on Health Related Quality of Life Among Patients With Chronic Pain by Interventional Pain Management

brief_summary.textblock:
How are the health related quality of life among patients with chronic pain effected by interventional pain managment?
Hypothesis:
Health related quality of life can be improved by interventional pain management both among patients with localizable pain focuses and among patients among whom no pain focuses can be found.
Method:
Health related quality of life using EQ-5D and EQ-VAS is registered at first visit, at the time of treatment for pain focuses an during the following 12 months.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Ecologic or Community, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: EQ-VAS is measured at first visit, at time for treatment and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment. EQ-VAS gives a value of quality of life, and mainly used to verify the results achieved from EQ-5D since it is not possible to calculate QALY from EQ-VAS

EQ-5D is assessed at first visit, at time for treatment and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment. Quality of life is calculated from EQ-5D using the TTO-valuated UK value sets. This value can also be used for calculation of QALY, Quality adjusted life years.

study_pop.textblock: Patients referred to a specialized interventional pain management clinic in northen sweden

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All patients
Exclusion Criteria:
-
